snippet.title: Cruise ship tourists flock to Tasmania
snippet.content: Cruise ship visitors are setting sail for Tasmania in record numbers, with an almost doubling in the most recent tourist season. More than 236,000 people cruised to the Apple Isle in 2016/17, a 45 per cent increase on the season prior. According to government figures, there were 95 port calls across the state and numbers are expected to keep growing with 138 ships booked to dock in 2017/18. Originally published as
